alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southeast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued August 20 at 1:24PM PDT until August 20 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, southeast winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust. * WHERE...Southeastern Imperial County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 11 PM PDT this evening. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, until 7 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds as well as reduced visibility. Light, unsecured objects will become airborne. Moderate tree and minor structural damage possible.
info.instruction: Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep your foot off the brake pedal. Remember, pull aside, stay alive. A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
